column6: I’m watching TV when WifeName walks into the room.
Honey… can we talk?
Sure* what’s going on?
I’ve been thinking about this for a long time and I think it’s going to be best for both of us.
WifeName takes a step forward and places a few papers on the table next to me.
I want a divorce.
I let out a nervous chuckle* not sure what else to do.
What? What do you mean?
These are divorce papers* I’ve already signed them so all you have to do is-
Is this a joke or something? Please tell me you’re joking.
Just sign the papers* please* it’ll make this all so much easier on us both if you do.
You can’t be serious. Is this really what you want?
… Yes.
… Okay. I’ll sign the papers.
Thank you. It really will make this so much easier. I’m really sorry that it had to come to this.
The look on her face tells me she really is sorry. Not that it helps much.
What are we going to do about the kids?
We can discuss that later. All that matters now is that we’re on the same page.
We should at least tell them. They deserve to know that things are going to change.
You’re right. Would you be able to tell them? I don’t think I have the strength to look them in the eyes right now.
Are you kidding me? No way will I sign those papers* you’re being insane!
This is what you always do* you never listen to me! I’m telling you I’m not happy anymore and you call me insane!
That’s because it IS insane! You don’t do this* you don’t just give up! When you love someone you fight for them* you don’t just-
I don’t love you anymore!
… What?
Her eyes drop to the floor.
I don’t love you anymore. I haven’t for a while now. I didn’t want to put the kids through a divorce so I tried* I really did* but I don’t see any other way to make it work.
I’m so stunned I can’t even respond.
Speaking of the kids… someone should tell them. Would you be able to? I don’t think I can.
Alright. I can tell them.
WifeName runs up and gives me a huge hug. At any other time this would’ve felt nice.
Oh* thank you so much! I just can’t face them right now.
I stay silent. I’m already trying to wrap my head around how to tell them. Without saying another word* I take my first step towards the kids’ room* dreading the conversation I’m about to have.
Absolutely not!. You can’t come in here and drop this one me then make me tell them. This was your call* you need to handle it yourself.
You think this isn’t hard on me too? I had no other choice* it wasn’t working!
I turn away* unable to look at her any more. I turn the TV up more and more* drowning out any words she tries to say to me. After a few more attempts* her face falls* and she walks out of the room.
We should present them a united front. They need to know that even though we’re getting divorced* we’re still on each other’s sides.
You’re right* that’s exactly what we should do.
She closes her eyes and takes a deep breath.
You ready?
She opens her eyes.
Absolutely. Let’s do this.
I walk into the kids’ room* a horrible wrenching in my gut. KidBoyName stirs* his tiny face looking up at mine.
Hey dad* what are you doing here?
His voice wakes up KidGirlName. Her eyes look like they’re peering into my soul.
Is everything okay?
Uhhh… um…
My brain has frozen. How can I possibly tell these two amazing children that their entire life is about to change?
Well* you see* your mother and I are getting a divorce.
What? Why?
Is it something we did?
The two of us enter the kids’ room. They’re both fast asleep. They look so peaceful.
Okay. We can do this.
I nod* and the two of us slowly wake up the children.
What’s going on?
Leave me alone* I’m trying to sleep.
Your father and I have something to tell you.
She looks over at me* waiting for me to speak.
Uh yeah… so…
I stumble over my words* but eventually WifeName and I are able to explain the situation to the kids.
Is it something we did?
Yeah* it was all KidGirlName’s fault right?
Oh my god honey* no* not at all.
WifeName goes over to KidGirlName and envelops her in a huge hug.
Mum and Dad’s problems have absolutely nothing to do with you two. You are the best things that ever happened to us.
We love you very very much* and we always will.
After a few more questions* we put the kids back to bed and leave the room.
Thank you for doing this with me. I know it must be really hard.
All that matters is that the kids are okay through all of this.
You’re right. We can discuss the other stuff later.

The two of us head to bed. It feels weird* sleeping there beside someone who just asked for a divorce* but at least it’s better than sleeping on the couch. I finally manage to drift off* dreading the day that I’m about to wake up to.
Your mother has decided she doesn’t love us anymore. She’s leaving us all.
What!?
How could she do that to us!
I don’t know kids* I just don’t know.
It feels good to put the blame on her* after all it pretty much is all her fault anyway. I know that* eventually* she’s going to find out about this* but for now* I feel a little better.
After a few more minutes of venting with the kids* I tuck them back into bed and head back to my bedroom.
How’d it go?
Yeah* really good. I think they’re going to be okay.
That’s great.
WifeName lets out a huge yawn.
You can tell me more about it in the morning. For now* I really need to get to sleep.
Me too.
The two of us fall asleep* making sure to keep to our sides of the bed. I can barely sleep* eventually dropping into unconsciousness hours later.
Looking down at KidGirlName’s face* her eyes filling with tears* I instantly crumble.
No* no* honey it’s not your fault at all. It’s my fault.
The kids’ faces immediately change.
What did you do?
Well when I say my fault* I don’t mean totally my fault.
It's too late. I can see it in their eyes* I’ve made myself the bad guy.
Did you hurt her?
No! No* I mean* emotionally maybe?
Every word that comes out of my mouth seems to be the wrong one. No matter how hard I try* I just keep making things worse. Eventually* I decide to cut my losses.
We can talk more in the morning. You guys need to get some sleep* you’ve got school tomorrow.
Whatever.
The kids refuse to give me a hug goodnight* and I head to the bedroom* totally defeated.
How’d it go?

I ignore WifeName completely* climbing into bed fully clothed and pretending to fall asleep. I spend the entire night coming up with ways to try to win the kids back* eventually falling asleep to dreams of a week-long Christmas and fortnightly trips to Disneyland.
… Yep. You guys did it.
I’m not sure why I said that* but I’ve got to stick with it now.
Yeah* uh* we just couldn’t handle having such terrible kids. It put so much pressure on our marriage that eventually we had to have a divorce.
KidBoyName seems frozen in shock* while KidGirlName starts bawling her eyes out. You don’t always know when you’ve screwed up as a parent* but boy* this is a big one.
There there… don’t cry. Please.
Are we going to get put up for adoption?
No* don’t be silly. Your mother and I will just take turns looking after you guys so we can get some rest.
KidGirlName starts crying even harder. I need to get out of here before I make things any worse.
So… yep. Great chat. See you guys tomorrow.
I practically sprint out of the room* racing back to my bedroom.
How’d it go?
Uh* yep* good. The kids are a little upset of course but I’m sure they’ll be better in the morning. Anyway I really have to get to bed so I’ll talk more tomorrow. Night.
I flip over and quickly pretend to fall asleep. I spend the entire night dreading seeing the kids tomorrow. They are most definitely not attending my funeral when I die.
No* it’s not your fault* it’s not anyone’s fault.
Then why are you guys getting a divorce?
Sometimes* people just grow apart. Even if no one does anything wrong.
Are you going to grow apart from us?
Of course not.
I give KidBoyName a hug and ruffle his hair.
Your mother and I love you both very much* and that will never change.
I tuck them both back into bed* happy with how the conversation had gone. I head back to my bedroom.
How’d it go?
Good. It went really well. They understand that it’s no one’s fault and that we both still love them.
Thank you. I really appreciate you doing that.
I smile and climb into bed. Neither of us know quite where to lie with our new situation* but we manage to get to sleep without too much trouble.
The breakfast table is remarkably quiet. No one quite knows what to say* so we just eat our scrambled eggs in complete silence.
Make sure you’ve got everything packed for school.
I do.
Me too.
That’s good.
The stress and awkwardness is suffocating. Just when I think I might pass out* an angel appears in the doorway.
Woof!
Hey DogName! How’s my little buddy doing!
I run over to DogName and scratch him behind the ear. Just looking at his face makes me feel like everything’s going to be alright.
DogName!
DogName!
The kids run over and start showering him with love and affection. For just a moment* everything feels normal.
Okay kids* let’s let DogName breathe. It’s time for school.
Awwww!
He'll be here when you get home. Come on* let’s go.
The kids reluctantly grab their bags and head off for school. As they head out the door* WifeName turns back to me.
I’ll see you tonight after work. Have a nice day.
Yeah* you too.
The three of them head out the door and I turn back to DogName.
What do you think bud. Should I go to work?
Woof!
That’s what I think too.
I let out a sigh. DogName is right* I can’t wallow in self-pity. I need to keep going to work* just like I always do* so the kids don’t feel like things are changing too much.
You are wise beyond your years DogName. Your dog years even.
Woof!
I pack up my things and head off for work.
I look deep into his doggy eyes and just know that I can’t leave him.
Okay fine* you’ve convinced me. Let’s have some fun!
Woof!
I spend the rest of the morning playing with DogName. WifeName is going to be so mad when she finds out* but for now I definitely needed this.
The table is still pretty quiet during meals* but at least I no longer feel like I’m about to lose consciousness.
PlayerName* can I ask you for a favour?
Uh* sure* what is it?
A couple of people from work are going out for drinks after our shift* so I was wondering if you could pick up the kids from school today so I can go.
Yeah* sure* I can do that. It’ll be good to spend some time with the kids.
Thank you PlayerName* I really appreciate it.
Yay* dad pick up!
Can we get ice cream on the way home?
I laugh. I’m already looking forward to picking them up.
Only if you guys are good at school. I want to hear all about your day when I come get you!
Well in order for that to happen they’ll have to get to school on time. Come on kids* time to go.
The kids run up and give me a hug before heading out to school. I need to make sure not to forget to pick them up this afternoon.
Does he have to?
Can you pick us up Mum? Pleeeeease?
Sorry kids* I’ll be able to pick you up tomorrow. Besides* this is a good chance to spend some time with Dad.
I can’t blame them for reacting this way after how I’ve acted recently* but it still really hurts.
If you guys are good* we can get ice cream on the way home.
They stop and think for a second* before smiling.
Okay* deal.
Great! Then we’re all in agreement. Now come on* it’s time for school. Let’s get in the car.
The kids grab their stuff and head to the car. Oh well* at least it’s a start. Now I just have to make sure not to forget to pick them up this afternoon.
Sorry* I can’t. I’m running pretty behind at work.
Oh… okay* that’s fair. I guess I can pick them up.
Does Dad not want to spend time with us?
No sweetie* that’s not it at all. I just have a lot of work to catch up on. We’ll spend time together some other time.
Come on kids* it’s time to leave for school.
The kids grab their bags and leave for school. I feel absolutely terrible for not agreeing to pick them up* but it’s too late to change it now.
Are you kidding me?
Look* sometimes we have to make sacrifices. I really need to catch up on work* I’m sorry if that messes up your plans.
You know* I might agree with you if I had ever seen you make a sacrifice for this family. But as far as I’m aware* every sacrifice that gets made has to be made by me.
That’s not fair! I make sacrifices all the time!
This isn’t the time* we can discuss this later. I need to take the kids to school now.
WifeName storms out of the house with the kids in tow. I have a feeling this isn’t going to be the last time I hear about this.
I need to remember to pick the kids up. WifeName would be a total nightmare if I forgot. She’d never stop bringing it up. Ever.
The kids race into the car* both of them speaking at such a rapid rate that I can’t make out what either is saying.
Okay okay* calm down! One at a time please.
Today* at school* there was this frog on the oval* and I touched it!
I got an A on my math test!
Wow! That’s very impressive both of you. You know what I think that deserves? Ice cream!
The car erupts with shouts of joy. KidBoyName’s face goes so red I’m worried he might explode.
ICE CREAM!!!
The kids sing some song about ice cream that I’ve never heard before the entire way to the shops* and race to pick out what flavours they want. By the time we get home* they both look exhausted.
Okay kids* make sure you get all your homework done before Mum gets home. Can you do that?
Do we get more ice cream if we do?
Only if you’re very quick.
With that both of the kids dart off to their room without another word. I drop down on the couch and attempt to catch my breath.
The kids get into the car and I’m met with total silence.
So… How was school?
Good.
Good.
I didn’t want to have to do this straight away* but it’s time to pull out the big guns.
So do you guys remember what we’re getting on the way home?
A small smile appears on their faces.
Ice cream?
Yes!
Their faces immediately light up.
Yay* ice cream!
Can I get chocolate?
You can get whatever you like.
The kids quickly forget that they’re mad at me as we travel to the shops and pick out their ice creams. By the time we get home* it’s almost like nothing is wrong.
Make sure you guys get all of our homework done before Mum gets home.
Okay dad.
The kids head off to their room and I let out a deep sigh. Somehow I managed to make that work. Now I get a well deserved rest before WifeName gets home.
WifeName arrives home to completed homework* happy children and dinner on the table.
Not to brag* but I kind of crushed it.
I really appreciate you helping out today.
She seems to be saying that genuinely* but there’s something in her eyes that tells me that’s not all she wanted to talk about tonight.
Is everything okay?
WifeName takes a deep breath before responding.
I think it would be best for both of us if you started sleeping on the couch.
Oh…
It's just been really awkward with us both in the same bed recently. I’m sure we’d both sleep better if we weren’t worrying about staying on our side of the bed.
WifeName arrives home to find me chilling on the couch.
Hey! How was your day?
Great* thanks for asking. Are the kids in their room?
The blood drains from my face.
So* stay calm* but I kind of forgot to pick them up.
WHAT!?
WifeName immediately runs out the door* returning twenty minutes later with two very angry looking children.
Hey kids. How was your day?
They both ignore me* walking straight to their rooms. I can’t exactly blame them.
You’re sleeping on the couch tonight.
That doesn’t seem necessary.
You know what? You’re right. What’s necessary is that you sleep on the couch every night from now on.
I-
I try to respond but WifeName immediately leaves the room. Looks like I’ll be sleeping on the couch for the foreseeable future.
I return home to find WifeName and the kids eating dinner.
Hey gang* what are we having tonight?
You can make yourself a sandwich if you like.
Oh* okay. I can do that.
I head into the kitchen to make a sandwich. I know better than to return to the table* instead choosing to eat my sandwich on the bed. A little while later* WifeName enters the room.
I think you should sleep on the couch.
Look I’m sorry I couldn’t pick up the kids* but I really did have some work to catch up on.
I understand. But if you’re not willing to make that sacrifice for the family then I think you should make another one. Sleeping on the couch is a great start.
Um… okay* yeah. You’re right* us sleeping in the same bed isn’t working. I’ll move my stuff.
Thank you. I think this will help us both.
Sure.

I quickly grab my pillow and make my way down to the couch. I’ve slept here before* but it feels significantly less comfortable than I remember. I try my best to find a decent sleeping position* but no matter what* I think I’m going to be waking up with a sore neck tomorrow.
That’s not happening.
Excuse me?
You heard me. This is my bed* I’m not leaving it just because you want me to.
WifeName lets out something that sounds like a mix between a frustrated sigh and the shriek of a banshee before grabbing her pillow.
Fine* but I’m not staying here with you. I’ll sleep on the couch.
Whatever! Do what you want.
WifeName storms out of the room. I drop into bed* finally able to stretch out* and have the best sleep that I’ve had in a while.
Family breakfast is quiet as ever when I get a call on my phone. I look down to see none other than the name of my best friend* FriendName. I quickly excuse myself from the table and answer the call.
PlayerName! How’re you doing you piece of garbage!
FriendName! Worse now that I’m hearing your voice!
FriendName laughs* but his voice quickly drops.
I heard about the… you know what. Are you doing okay?
Yeah I’m doing okay. It’s a bit tough but I’m getting through it.
I’m glad to hear that man. You know that no matter what* I’m here for you* right?
Yeah of course I know that. Thanks.
Any time. I’ll see you soon. Poker night is still on right?
Absolutely* no way that gets cancelled.
Awesome! I’ll see you Friday.
See you then.
I’m really lucky to have a friend like FriendName. I head back to breakfast with a smile on my face* ready to take on the rest of the day.
Come on man* I know you. You don’t have to lie to me.
Really* I’m fine.
Okay then.
I can tell in his voice that he doesn’t believe me* and honestly* neither do I. This has been really tough and I’m not sure how much longer I can take it.
I’ll talk to you later* okay? We’ve still got poker night on Friday.
Yeah okay* cool. See you then.
He hangs up* leaving me feeling even worse than I did before. I head back to breakfast* getting through it as quick as I can and heading out to do something to take my mind off of it all.
Honestly* I’m not doing so well.
I’m sorry to hear that. What’s going on?
I spend the next couple of minutes explaining everything to FriendName. He’s a good listener* and I appreciate the fact that he’s here for me. By the end* I almost feel a little better.
That’s terrible. Is there anything I can do?
Just make sure you come to poker night this Friday. I really need the distraction.
You got it PlayerName. I hope you’re ready to lose all your money.
That’s not quite how I remember last week going.
You got lucky! That won’t happen again.
Whatever you say. See you Friday.
Bye!

I hang up and take a breath. I’m glad I opened up to FriendName about all of this* I’m sure I’ll need his support in the future. For now* I just head back to the table and finish breakfast with the family.
WifeName sends the kids to bed early tonight* which I take as not a good sign.
There’s something I need to talk to you about.
My mind is racing. What’s next? Surely she isn’t going to ask me to cancel poker night.
I’ve contacted the court and we have a hearing set for tomorrow afternoon. It’s really important that you come so we can get started on the divorce proceedings.
That’s worse.
Yeah* sure. I’ll be there.
WifeName nods.
Good.
So* what sort of stuff are we going to go over at this hearing.
Oh you know. The usual stuff. Division of assets* nullification of the marriage. Child custody.
She tries to slip the last one in casually but it doesn’t work.
Child custody? Are you going to try to take the kids?
What* no* of course not. It’s just something we need to discuss.
Right* sorry. I shouldn’t have freaked out there* of course we’re going to share the kids.
Exactly. I’m glad you feel that way.
Of course. These kids need both of their parents in their life. Fighting each other for them will only make things worse.
WifeName gives me a hug* evidently relieved that the conversation didn’t turn into a huge fight.
I’m so happy that we’re on the same page about this.
Yeah* me too.
With that* the two of us head off to our respective sleeping arrangements. I’m not looking forward to the hearing tomorrow* but it seems like at least we’ll be in agreement of at least one thing.
Actually… I think you should.
What?
Well* initially it seemed weird* but after thinking about it for a second* I think you should. You’re way better with the kids than I am* and honestly* I’m not sure how much I can provide for them.
Are you sure?
I think so. All that movement* half a week here and half a week there* that’s no life for a kid. When all this is done* I think they should live with you.
If that’s what you want* then okay.
I nod. The kids aren’t going to like this* I’m sure to them it’ll seem like I’m abandoning them. Tomorrow’s hearing is going to be hard* but in the end it’s for the best.
I don’t think so. Those kids are my life* and once all this is done* they’re living with me.
PlayerName* there’s no need to do this. We can share custody. The kids need us both in their lives.
You’re welcome to fight* but I’m filing for sole custody. See you in court.
With that I walk out of the room and get ready to sleep. At least with our new sleeping arrangements* I no longer have to worry about seeing her for the rest of the night.
I enter the courtroom to find WifeName waiting there* alongside a judge* and one of the most stunning people I’ve ever seen. The vision of perfection steps towards me and holds out a hand.
Hi* I’m HotDivorceLawyerName. I’ve been appointed by the court to help everything get sorted out smoothly.
It is incredibly nice to meet you. Maybe after this is all done* we can go get a drink or something.
HotDivorceLawyerName laughs* but WifeName doesn’t seem very impressed.
I appreciate the invitation* but I don’t think that would be very appropriate considering the situation.
Agreed. Can we please get started?
Of course.
It’s nice to meet you HotDivorceLawyerName. I appreciate you helping us.
Are we ready to get started?
Absolutely* let’s begin.
The court proceedings travel fairly smoothy. WifeName and I are both reasonable and resolve most of the asset division without any problems.
On to the next point of order. Custody.
WifeName and I look at it each. This is it. Whatever choice I make here will massively affect how the rest of this divorce goes.
PlayerName* what would you like to do in regards to custody of your children* KidBoyName and KidGirlName?
I want full custody.
You have no right to do that!
Legally* there’s nothing stopping PlayerName from filing for full custody.
What’s best for our children is for them to live with me.
Well then I’m filing for full custody too!
HotDivorceLawyerName immediately starts writing up the paperwork. I can’t help but admire their efficiency.
Then it is settled. At the next hearing* both parties should prepare arguments of why they believe the other parent is unfit for custody of the children.
WifeName and I exchange glares as we leave the courtroom.
I can’t believe you did that.
I’m just doing what I believe would be best for the kids. I won’t apologise for that.
Well it’s in motion now. We just need to make sure not to fight infront of the kids.
Agreed. Let’s do our best to remain civil.
The two of us nod* before heading off on our separate ways.
I think WifeName should live with the kids.
HotDivorceLawyerName starts filling out paperwork. I could be imagining it but I think they look kind of disappointed.
Thank you* PlayerName.
Both parties are in agreement. At the next hearing* arrangements for visitation can be finalised.
As we leave the court room* WifeName speaks to me.
That was really mature of you. I promise I will be very reasonable when we discuss visitation.
Thanks. It was the right call to make.
The two of us say our goodbyes and set off as night starts to fall.
We should have shared custody.
I agree. The kids deserve to live with both of their parents.
column16: MC Happiness Up* Gain ‘Wants Split Custody’

column6: Great! If that is the case then on the next court date we can go over a custody schedule.
The paperwork is quickly written up and WifeName and I leave the court together.
I’m really glad that we’re on the same page. I was so worried that this would turn into a massive fight.
The happiness of our children is much more important than any petty fights we could have.
We chat for a couple more minutes before both heading out.
Actually* I want to file for full custody. I don’t believe PlayerName is a fit parent.
Excuse me? Then I’m filing for full custody too!
If that is the case* then both parties should prepare arguments for why they believe the other is an unfit parent for these children. They can be heard at the next hearing.
The rest of the court session is spent in silence as HotDivorceLawyerName fills out the paperwork. As we leave the court I go over to WifeName.
What’s wrong with you?
We both know you’re not fit to be a parent. I’m just looking out for our children.
There’s no point talking to her. I’ll just have to prove that I’m not an unfit parent. The two of us head off in separate directions without saying goodbye.
WifeName and the kids are already out of the house when I get up for breakfast. DogName sits by the table* perking up when I walk into the room.
Guess it’s just you and me DogName.
Woof!
As I finish off breakfast and head for the door* an object catches my eye. Besides the door* almost as if placed there by the universe as a sign* is DogName’s leash.
Hmmm. I wonder. Surely WifeName won’t mind if I take a short detour before work.
Say… do you want to go for a walk?
As soon as the magic word leaves my mouth* DogName goes berserk.
column16: Dog Attitude Up* Wife Attitude Down

column6: Woof! Woof! Woof!
I’ll take that as a yes.
I hook up the leash to DogName’s collar and follow him out of the door.
DogName! Slow down!
DogName races around the street* pulling me along behind. I have to use all of my strength to keep him from darting onto the road.
Woof! Woof!
At least you’re having fun.
By the time I manage to finish the walk and wrangle DogName back inside* I’m completely exhausted* and my arm feels like it’s about to fall off.
Maybe we stick to playing in the backyard next time.
Woof!
Sorry buddy* I’ve got some important stuff to do at work today.
column16: Dog Attitude Down* Wife Attitude Up* MC Happiness Down

column6: I head out the door and head to work. I try my best to focus but I spend most of the day wishing that I’d hung out with DogName.

I’ve just finished putting the kids to bed when the doorbell rings. I quickly run over and open the door to see FriendName holding up a six pack of beers and a stack of notes* four of our other friends gathered around him.
You ready to get demolished?
If get demolished means win all your money then I sure am.
FriendName laughs and walks in* setting up his place at the table with the rest of the guys.
Everyone please just remember to keep it down* the kids are sleeping.
A chorus of boos emanates from the table* followed by laughter and scattered agreement.
Of course man* those kids are going to get the best sleep of their lives.
The poker begins* and everyone keeps their promise. A few hands in* I’ve already managed to take a sizeable chip lead.
I’m sorry PlayerName. I didn’t want to do this* but you’ve left me no choice.
FriendName pulls out a pair of dark sunglasses and a cap* immediately putting them on.
This is what all the professional poker players wear. It’s where they get their power from.
I’m so scared.
Play continues* and shockingly FriendName actually starts winning some hands.
Have you got a secret spy camera in those glasses or something?
What? Of course not! It’s in the cap.
Finally* I get a couple of good cards. Play goes around the table until it’s just me and FriendName. FriendName pushes his entire stack into the middle of the table.
I’m all-in. Can you handle the heat?
I stare deep into his sunglassed eyes. I’m looking for anything* a twitch* a wince* a cough* but he’s completely still. I can’t read him.
Come on PlayerName* we don’t have all day! Are you in or out?
I’m in.
I push all my chips into the centre of the table with FriendName’s.
On the count of three* reveal your cards. One* two* three!
We both flip up our cards and I see* to my horror* a pair of aces in his hand.
Unlucky PlayerName. Guess the sunglasses were too much for you.
